member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.OptionsSettings.VoiceAlwaysRecording
member.summary: If false, call Start and Stop recording before and after push-to-talk key is pressed. This was the original default behavior, but causes a hitch for some players. As a workaround we can always keep the microphone rolling and only send data when the push-to-talk key is held. (public issue #4248)

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.OptionsSettings.shouldNametagFadeOut

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.OptionsSettings.ShouldAnonymizeMultiplayerDetails
member.summary:
If true, hide identifiable details of other multiplayer clients like avatars, player names, number of players online, server name, etc. Live streamers may find this useful to help prevent stream sniping.
Separated from the older "streamer mode" option.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.OptionsSettings.ShouldHideRichPresence
member.summary:
If true, don't share details like "editing map X" or "join" with Steam. Useful for anyone who might be targeted / followed into servers, or who has a project to keep secret.
Separated from the older "streamer mode" option.

Can be used by plugins to verify player is on a particular server.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.InputEx.ConsumeKeyDown(UnityEngine.KeyCode)
member.summary:
Should be used anywhere that Input.GetKeyDown opens a UI.
Each frame one input event can be consumed. This is a hack to prevent multiple UI-related key presses from interfering during the same frame. Only the first input event proceeds, while the others are ignored.
member.returns: True if caller should proceed, false otherwise.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.ServerBookmarkDetails.host
member.summary:
IP address or DNS name to use as-is, or a web address to perform GET request. Servers not using Fake IP can specify just a DNS entry and a static query port. Servers using Fake IP are assigned random ports at startup, but can implement a web API endpoint to return the IP and port.
Nelson 2025-01-20: Making this optional now. The downside is we can't perform a Steam A2S query without IP/port, but the upside is players can more easily join their non-port-forwarded servers.

member.summary: Steam query port. Zero for servers using Fake IP.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.PlayerInventory.search(System.Collections.Generic.List{SDG.Unturned.InventorySearch},SDG.Unturned.EItemType)
member.summary: Please use SearchContents instead! To perform an equivalent search: • Set IncludeEquipmentSlots to false. • Set IncludeActiveStorageContainer to false. • Set ItemType to type. • Set IncludeEmpty to false. • Set IncludeMaxQuality to true. OR use the nearly drop-in replacement FindItemsByType.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.PlayerInventory.search(SDG.Unturned.EItemType,System.UInt16[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Please use SearchContents instead! To perform an equivalent search: • Set IncludeEquipmentSlots to false. • Set IncludeActiveStorageContainer to false. • Set ItemType to type. • Set IncludeEmpty to false. • Set IncludeMaxQuality to true. • Set AnyCaliberIds to calibers. • Set IncludeUnspecifiedCaliber to allowZeroCaliber. OR use the nearly drop-in replacement FindAttachmentsByCaliber.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.PlayerInventory.search(System.Collections.Generic.List{SDG.Unturned.InventorySearch},SDG.Unturned.EItemType,System.UInt16,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Please use SearchContents instead! To perform an equivalent search: • Set IncludeEquipmentSlots to false. • Set IncludeActiveStorageContainer to false. • Set ItemType to type. • Set IncludeEmpty to false. • Set IncludeMaxQuality to true. • Set CaliberId to caliber. • Set IncludeUnspecifiedCaliber to allowZeroCaliber. OR use the nearly drop-in replacement FindAttachmentsByCaliber.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.PlayerInventory.search(System.Collections.Generic.List{SDG.Unturned.InventorySearch},System.UInt16,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Please use SearchContents instead! To perform an equivalent search: • Set IncludeEquipmentSlots to false. • Set IncludeActiveStorageContainer to false. • Set AssetRef to id. • Set IncludeEmpty to findEmpty. • Set IncludeMaxQuality to findHealthy. OR use the nearly drop-in replacement FindItemsByAsset.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.PlayerInventory.has(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Please use SearchContents instead! To perform an equivalent search: • Set IncludeEquipmentSlots to true. • Set IncludeActiveStorageContainer to true. • Set MaxResultsCount to 1. • Set AssetRef to id. • Set IncludeEmpty to false. • Set IncludeMaxQuality to true. OR use the nearly drop-in replacements FindFirstItemByAsset or HasItemByAsset.

member.summary:
If true, sets the Magazine attachment hook inactive while this skin is applied. (guns only)
Nelson 2025-03-10: Adding this to address mismatched Ace bullets with certain skins. (public issue #4923) It should be fine for vanilla guns because there shouldn't be assumptions about Magazine enable/disable, but modded guns may have different expectations (particularly with GunAttachmentEventHook).

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.SteamPlayerID.characterID
member.summary: In vanilla this field is ONLY used for the per-character saves on servers. If that changes check that it does not affect the savedata options.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.SteamPlayerID.GetHwids
member.summary:
20-byte SHA1 salted hashes of client's hardware ID(s). Providing multiple HWIDs makes it more difficult to bypass HWID bans because spoofing a single component only changes one of the bans. For example spoofing the MAC address will not spoof the Windows GUID.
Randomized if system did not support hwid, or perhaps player is cheating. Should not be called on the client side, but just in case there is a default zeroed array.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.SteamPlayerID.BypassIntegrityChecks
member.summary: Ignore requests to kick me in debug mode. :) Steam ID may not have been authenticated yet here which may seem like a security risk, but fortunately that would get caught when Steam auth ticket response is received.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.SteamPlayerID.hwids
member.summary: Array of 20-byte SHA1 hashes.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.SteamIPAddress_tEx.TryGetIPv4Address(Steamworks.SteamIPAddress_t,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Steam APIs returned uint32 IPv4 addresses in the past, so Unturned code depends on them in some places. Ideally these uses should be updated for IPv6 support going forward. For the meantime this method converts from the new format to the old format for backwards compatibility.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.InteractableVehicle.batteryCharge
member.summary: Nelson 2024-06-24: When first implementing batteries there was only the vanilla battery item, and it was fine to delete it when the charge reached zero. This may not be desirable, however, so zero now represents no battery item is present, and one represents the battery is completely drained but still there.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.InteractableVehicle.isInsideSafezone
member.summary: Is this vehicle inside a safezone?

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.InteractableVehicle.timeInsideSafezone
member.summary: Duration in seconds since this vehicle entered a safezone, or -1 if it's not in a safezone.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.InteractableVehicle.isInsideNoDamageZone
member.summary: Should askDamage requests currently be ignored because we are inside a safezone?

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.InteractableVehicle.isEngineOn
member.summary: Nelson 2024-06-24: This property is confusing, especially with isEnginePowered, but essentially represents starting the engine ignition when a player enters the driver's seat. If true, there's a driver, there was sufficient battery to start (or battery not required), and the engine wasn't underwater.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.InteractableVehicle.HasBatteryWithCharge
member.summary: Doesn't imply the vehicle *uses* batteries, only that it contains a battery item with some charge left.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.InteractableVehicle.ContainsBatteryItem
member.summary: Doesn't imply the vehicle *uses* batteries, only that it contains a (potentially uncharged) battery item.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.InteractableVehicle.WasNaturallySpawned
member.summary:
Nelson 2024-11-13: Adding this primarily to indicate whether a vehicle was spawned by the level versus placed by a player or bought from a vendor. This way if the number of "naturally"-spawned vehicles is below a certain threshold the level can spawn more. (e.g., a server where players have hoarded a bunch of vendor-purchased vehicles and no default vehicles are left for new players.)
Only available on the server. Defaults to true for old saves to prevent suddenly spawning a bunch more vehicles.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.InteractableVehicle.canUseTurret

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.InteractableVehicle.MarkForReplicationUpdate
member.summary: Primarily for backwards compatibility with plugins. Previously, multiple "updates" could be queued per vehicle and sent to clients. This list was public, unfortunately, so plugins may rely on submitting vehicle updates. After making it obsolete each vehicle can only be flagged as needing a replication update, and this is reset after each server replication update.

member.summary: Raycast along a given direction, penetrating through barricades attached to THIS vehicle. Returns point at the end of the ray if unblocked, or a safe (radius) distance away from hit.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.InteractableVehicle.getExitSpawnPoint(SDG.Unturned.Player,UnityEngine.Vector3@,System.Byte@)
member.summary:
Fallback if there are absolutely no good exit points. Sets point and angle with a normal player spawnpoint.
Once vehicle is completely surrounded there is no nice way to pick an exit point. Finding a point upwards is abused to teleport upward into bases, finding an empty capsule nearby is abused to teleport through walls, so if we're sure there isn't a nice exit point we can fallback to teleporting them to a safe spawnpoint.

member.summary: Initially use tryGetExit to find a safe exit, but if one isn't available then fallback to getExitSpawnPoint.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.InteractableVehicle.hasUnityCalledStart
member.summary: Nelson 2025-05-05: ran into a bug where our manual OnUpdate is called before Unity calls Start!

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.InteractableVehicle.OnUpdate(System.Single)
member.summary:
Nelson 2025-05-02: keeping the previous comment from 2020-11-26 here. At first I wondered if 24 vehicles wasn't enough to properly test, but even with a higher vehicle count it can seemingly be *slower* to call Update manually. That said, calling Update manually does give us the option to time-slice vehicle updates. On the client and singleplayer we now update vehicles outside render distance at a lower frequency which saves ~0.1 ms per frame on my PC.
2020-11-26 experimented with dispatching all vehicle updates from C# in VehicleManager because they make up a significant portion of the MonoBehaviour Update, but the savings on my PC with 24 vehicles on PEI was minor. Not worth the potential troubles.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.InteractableVehicle.UpdateBicyclePedals

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.ItemBarricadeAsset.shouldBypassPickupOwnership

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.ItemBarricadeAsset.AllowPlacementInsideClipVolumes

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.ItemBarricadeAsset.placementPreviewRef
member.summary: Optional alternative barricade prefab specifically for the client preview spawned.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.ItemBarricadeAsset.CanParentVehicleBePickedUp
member.summary: By default, vehicles with "hooks" (such as the Skycrane) cannot pick up vehicles with barricades attached. If all barricades on the vehicle set this to true then the vehicle *can* be picked up. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.ItemBarricadeAsset.VehicleGuid
member.summary: Vehicle to place. Supports redirects by VehicleRedirectorAsset. If redirector's SpawnPaintColor is set, that color is used.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.ItemBarricadeAsset.VehicleId
member.summary: Legacy ID of vehicle to place. Supports redirects by VehicleRedirectorAsset. If redirector's SpawnPaintColor is set, that color is used.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.ItemBarricadeAsset.FindVehicleAsset
member.summary: Returned asset is not necessarily a vehicle asset yet: It can also be a VehicleRedirectorAsset which the vehicle spawner requires to properly set paint color.

member.name: T:SDG.Unturned.CollisionEventHook
member.summary: Can be added to any GameObject with a Trigger to receive events. Ensure that Layer will detect player overlaps. Trap is a good candidate.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.CollisionEventHook.OnPlayerEnter
member.summary: Invoked when a player enters the trigger. Called before OnFirstPlayerEnter.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.CollisionEventHook.OnPlayerExit
member.summary: Invoked when a player exits the trigger. Called before OnAllPlayersExit.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.CollisionEventHook.OnFirstPlayerEnter
member.summary: Invoked when first player enters the trigger, and not again until all players have left. Called after OnPlayerEnter.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.CollisionEventHook.OnAllPlayersExit
member.summary: Invoked when last player exits the trigger. Called after OnPlayerExit.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.BlueprintSupply.ShouldExcludeFullAmount

member.name: T:SDG.Unturned.EVehicleBuildablePlacementRule
member.summary: Controls whether vehicle allows barricades to be attached to it.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.EVehicleBuildablePlacementRule.None
member.summary: Vehicle does not override placement. This means, by default, that barricades can be placed on the vehicle unless the barricade sets Allow_Placement_On_Vehicle to false. (e.g., beds and sentry guns) Note that gameplay config Bypass_Buildable_Mobility, if true, takes priority.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.EVehicleBuildablePlacementRule.AlwaysAllow
member.summary: Vehicle allows any barricade to be placed on it, regardless of the barricade's Allow_Placement_On_Vehicle setting. The legacy option for this was the Supports_Mobile_Buildables flag. Vanilla trains originally used this option, but it was exploited to move beds into tunnel walls.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.EVehicleBuildablePlacementRule.Block
member.summary: Vehicle prevents any barricade from being placed on it. Note that gameplay config Bypass_Buildable_Mobility, if true, takes priority.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.VehicleRandomPaintColorConfiguration.grayscaleChance
member.summary: [0, 1] color will have zero saturation if random value is less than this. For example, 0.2 means 20% of vehicles will be grayscale.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.VehicleWheelConfiguration.wasAutomaticallyGenerated
member.summary: If true, this configuration was created by . Otherwise, this configuration was loaded from the vehicle asset file.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.VehicleWheelConfiguration.wheelColliderPath
member.summary: Transform path relative to Vehicle prefab with WheelCollider component.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.VehicleWheelConfiguration.isColliderPowered
member.summary: If true, WheelCollider's motorTorque is set according to accelerator input.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.VehicleWheelConfiguration.modelPath
member.summary: Transform path relative to Vehicle prefab. Animated to match WheelCollider state.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.VehicleWheelConfiguration.isModelSteered
member.summary: If true, model is animated according to steering input. Only kept for backwards compatibility. Prior to wheel configurations, only certain WheelColliders actually received steering input, while multiple models would appear to steer. For example, the APC's front 4 wheels appeared to rotate but only the front 2 actually affected physics.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.VehicleWheelConfiguration.modelUseColliderPose
member.summary: If true, model ignores isModelSteered and instead uses WheelCollider.GetWorldPose when simulating or the replicated state from the server when not simulating. Defaults to false.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.VehicleWheelConfiguration.modelRadius
member.summary: If greater than zero, visual-only wheels (without a collider) like the extra wheels of the Snowmobile use this radius to calculate their rolling speed.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.VehicleWheelConfiguration.copyColliderRpmIndex
member.summary: If set, visual-only wheels without a collider (like the back wheels of the snowmobile) can copy RPM from a wheel that does have a collider. Requires modelRadius to also be set.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.VehicleWheelConfiguration.copyCrawlerTrackSpeedIndex
member.summary: If set, wheel model uses this crawler track's speed (average RPM of wheels). Prevents wheel model from spinning out of sync with overall track.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.VehicleWheelConfiguration.steeringAngleMultiplier
member.summary: Target steering angle is multiplied by this value. For example, can be set to a negative number for rear-wheel steering. Defaults to 1.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.VehicleWheelConfiguration.modelSuspensionOffset
member.summary: Vertical offset of model from simulated suspension position.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.VehicleWheelConfiguration.modelSuspensionSpeed
member.summary: How quickly to interpolate model toward suspension position in meters per second. If negative, position teleports immediately.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.VehicleWheelConfiguration.motionEffectsMode
member.summary: Nelson 2024-12-06: Initially implemented as a minimum and maximum percentage of normalized forward velocity, but think this is more practical. I can't think of why we would use values other than -1, 0, +1 for that, and if we did we'd probably want some tuning for the angle particles are emitted at.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.VehicleWheelConfiguration.canExplode
member.summary: If true, wheel should fly off when vehicle explodes. Defaults to true. Used to simplify destroying vehicles with crawler tracks.

member.summary: Default.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.CrawlerTrackTilingMaterial.repeatDistance
member.summary:
How far to travel to offset UV 1x. (1/x)
You can calculate RepeatDistance by selecting an edge parallel to the crawler track and dividing the UV distance by the physical 3D distance. For example, if the UV length is 2 and the 3D length is 1.5 m then the texture repeats 1.33 UV/m.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.CrawlerTrackTilingMaterial.uvDirection
member.summary: UV mainTextureOffset per distance traveled.

member.summary: Please refer to:

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.VehicleAsset.FindSharedSkinVehicleAsset
member.summary:
Supports redirects by VehicleRedirectorAsset.
"Shared Skins" were implemented when there were several asset variants of each vehicle. For example, Off_Roader_Orange, Off_Roader_Purple, Off_Roader_Green, etc. Each vehicle had their "shared skin" set to the same ID, and the skin asset had its target ID set to the shared ID. This isn't as necessary after merging vanilla vehicle variants, but some mods may rely on it, and it needed GUID support now that the target vehicle might not have a legacy ID.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.VehicleAsset.hasLoadedModel
member.summary: Prevents calling getOrLoad redundantly if asset does not exist.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.VehicleAsset.OnServerModelLoaded(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: Clip.prefab

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.VehicleAsset.OnClientModelLoaded(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: Vehicle.prefab

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.VehicleAsset.BuildAutomaticWheelConfiguration(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary:
Nelson 2024-02-28: Prior to the VehicleWheelConfiguration class, most of the wheel configuration was inferred during InteractableVehicle initialization from the children of the "Tires" and "Wheels" transforms. Confusingly, "Tires" only contains WheelColliders and "Wheels" only contains the visual models. Rather than keeping the old behavior in InteractableVehicle alongside the newer more configurable one, we match the old behavior here to generate an equivalent configuration.
Note that must be initialized before this is called (by loading model).

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.BrowserConfigData.Login_Token
member.summary: https://steamcommunity.com/dev/managegameservers

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.BrowserConfigData.BookmarkHost
member.summary:
IP address, DNS name, or a web address (to perform GET request) to advertise.
Servers not using Fake IP can specify just a DNS entry. This way if server's IP changes clients can rejoin. For example, if you own the "example.com" domain you could add an A record "myunturnedserver" pointing at your game server IP and set that record here "myunturnedserver.example.com".
Servers using Fake IP are assigned random ports at startup, but can implement a web API endpoint to return the IP and port. Clients perform a GET request if this string starts with http:// or https://. The returned text can be an IP address or DNS name with optional query port override. (e.g., "127.0.0.1:27015")

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.BrowserConfigData.Is_Using_Anycast_Proxy
member.summary: If true, the server lobby warns that in-game ping may be higher than shown. BUT it's shown in the default UI color rather than the "bad" color when flagged by moderation.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.ServerConfigData.Join_Rate_Limit_Window_Seconds
member.summary: If ready-to-connect messages are received more than twice from the same client in less than this many seconds they will be kicked.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.ServerConfigData.Bad_Packet_Rate_Limit_Window_Seconds
member.summary: If bad packets (that *may* be legitimate) are received more than threshold times within this many seconds of each other, reject the calling connection.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.ServerConfigData.Bad_Packet_Rate_Limit_Threshold
member.summary: If more than this many bad packets (that *may* be legitimate) are received within window seconds of each other, reject the calling connection.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.ServerConfigData.Rate_Limit_Kick_Threshold
member.summary: If a rate-limited method is called this many times within cooldown window the client will be kicked. For example a value of 1 means the client will be kicked the first time they call the method off-cooldown. (not recommended)

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.ServerConfigData.Max_Clients_With_Same_IP_Address
member.summary:
Only applicable when Fake IP is off. When a client is connecting, if their connection would push the number of simultaneous connections from the same IP address past this number, they are prevented from joining.
May be useful to prevent against fake join requests coming from a single source IP. (public issue #5001)
Defaults to a high value because some regions will have many more clients with the same IPv4 address than others. For example, due to Carrier-grade NAT (CGNAT).

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.ServerConfigData.Max_Clients_With_Same_IP_Address_Log_Warnings
member.summary: Whether rejections for Max_Clients_With_Same_IP_Address should log to command output. Useful for checking if the limit is appropriate.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.ServerConfigData.Fake_Lag_Threshold_Seconds
member.summary: Ordinarily the server should be receiving multiple input packets per second from a client. If more than this amount of time passes between input packets we flag the client as potentially using a lag switch, and modify their stats (e.g. reduce player damage) for a corresponding duration. Minimum value is PlayerInput.MIN_FAKE_LAG_THRESHOLD_SECONDS.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.ServerConfigData.Fake_Lag_Log_Warnings
member.summary: Whether fake lag detection should log to command output. False positives are relatively likely when client framerate hitches (e.g. loading dense region), so this is best used for tuning threshold rather than bans.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.ServerConfigData.Fake_Lag_Damage_Penalty_Multiplier
member.summary: PvP damage multiplier while under fake lag penalty.

member.summary: Should we kick players if they do not submit inputs for a long time?

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.ServerConfigData.Reset_Vehicles_Outside_Horizontal_Distance
member.summary: If greater than zero, vehicles with XZ position outside this threshold are saved in the center of the map. By default, vehicles outside ±40 km are teleported into the map. Intended to help with physics issues caused by vehicles far out in space. (public issue #4465)

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.ServerConfigData.CLIENT_TIMEOUT_QUEUE_SECONDS

member.name: T:SDG.Unturned.ICraftingTagProvider
member.summary: Implemented by "root" component of each entity type that can provide crafting tags to nearby players. This allows overlap with a barricade attached to a vehicle to find the barricade from barricade collider and vehicle from vehicle collider rather than using transform root. Any mod hook extensions to crafting tags will be sibling components or descendants of this component.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.GunAttachmentEventHook.EAssetChangeBehavior.InvokeDetachedThenAttached

member.summary: Optional alternative item prefab specifically for the PlayerEquipment prefab spawned.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.ItemAsset.instantiatedItemName
member.summary: Name to use when instantiating item prefab. By default the asset legacy id is used, but it can be overridden because some modders rely on the name for Unity's legacy animation component. For example in Toothy Deerryte's case there were a lot of duplicate animations to work around the id naming, simplified by overriding name.

member.summary: Movement speed multiplier while the item is equipped in the hands.

member.summary: If this item is compatible with skins for another item, lookup that item's ID instead.

member.summary: Defaults to true. If false, skin material and mesh are not applied when is set. For example, a custom axe can transfer the kill counter and ragdoll effect from a vanilla item's skin without also transferring the material and mesh.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.ItemAsset.canBeUsedInSafezone(SDG.Unturned.SafezoneNode,System.Boolean)

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.ItemAsset.shouldDeleteAtZeroQuality
member.summary: Should this item be deleted when using and quality hits zero? e.g. final melee hit shatters the weapon.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.ItemAsset.shouldDestroyItemColliders
member.summary: Should the game destroy all child colliders on the item when requested? Physics items in the world and on character preview don't request destroy, but items attached to the character do. Mods might be using colliders in unexpected ways (e.g., riot shield) so they can disable this default.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.PlayerVoice.compressedVoiceBuffer
member.summary: Speaker writes compressed audio to this buffer. Listener copies network buffer here for decompression.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.PlayerVoice.DECOMPRESSED_VOICE_BUFFER
member.summary: Listener writes decompressed PCM data to this buffer.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.PlayerVoice.RECORDING_POLL_INTERVAL
member.summary: Seconds interval to wait between asking recording subsystem for voice data. Rather than polling every frame we wait until data has accumulated to send.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.PlayerVoice.PLAYBACK_DELAY
member.summary: Seconds to wait before playing back newly received data. Allows a few samples to buffer up so that we don't stutter as more arrive.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.PlayerVoice.SILENCE_DURATION
member.summary: Seconds to wait after playback before stopping audio source. We zero this portion of the clip to prevent pops.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.PlayerVoice.EXPECTED_ASKVOICE_PER_SECOND
member.summary: Max calls to askVoice server will allow per second before blocking their voice data. Prevents spamming many tiny requests bogging down server output.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.PlayerVoice.EXPECTED_BYTES_PER_SECOND
member.summary: Max compressed bytes server will allow per second before blocking their voice data. When logging compressed size they averaged 3000-5000 per second, so this affords some wiggle-room.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.PlayerVoice._isTalking
member.summary: Internal value managed by isTalking.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.PlayerVoice.isPlayingVoiceData

member.name: T:SDG.Unturned.CachingBcAssetRef
member.summary: Backwards-Compatible Asset Reference with Caching • Supports both GUID and legacy ID. • Caches resolved asset and updates if asset has been reloaded. • Parsing legacy ID without context requires "LegacyType:LegacyID" format. E.g., "Item:4" for the Eaglefire. • See CachingAssetRef if legacy ID support is unnecessary.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.CachingBcAssetRef.IsEmpty
member.summary: If true, doesn't reference anything. Could also be called "IsZero" or "IsNull".

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.CachingBcAssetRef.IsAssigned
member.summary: Opposite of IsEmpty.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.CachingBcAssetRef.Guid
member.summary: Assigned GUID, not the referenced asset's GUID.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.CachingBcAssetRef.LegacyId
member.summary: Assigned legacy ID, not the referenced asset's legacy ID.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.CachingBcAssetRef.LegacyType
member.summary: Assigned legacy type, not the referenced asset's legacy type.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.CachingBcAssetRef.IsReferenceTo(SDG.Unturned.Asset)
member.summary: Doesn't only check (Get() == asset) because a new asset may have loaded. Rather, checks whether GUID or legacy ID (whichever is set) points at asset. If asset is null, returns true if GUID and legacy ID are zero.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.CachingBcAssetRef.TryParse(System.String,SDG.Unturned.EAssetType,SDG.Unturned.CachingBcAssetRef@)
member.summary: Supports both GUID and legacy ID formats. - If input string contains ':' the first part is EAssetType and the second part is legacy ID. - If defaultLegacyType is not None the input string can be parsed as a legacy ID. - Otherwise, parsed as GUID.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.CachingBcAssetRef.TryParse(System.String,SDG.Unturned.CachingBcAssetRef@)
member.summary: Supports both GUID and legacy ID formats. - If input string contains ':' the first part is EAssetType and the second part is legacy ID. - Otherwise, parsed as GUID.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.ItemClothingAsset.armor
member.summary: Multiplier to incoming damage. Defaults to 1.0.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.ItemClothingAsset.explosionArmor
member.summary: Multiplier to explosive damage. Defaults to value if Armor_Explosion isn't specified.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.ItemClothingAsset.fallingDamageMultiplier
member.summary: Armor against falling damage. Defaults to 1.0, i.e., take the normal amount of damage.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.ItemClothingAsset.preventsFallingBrokenBones
member.summary: If true on any worn clothing item, bones never break when falling. Defaults to false.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.ItemClothingAsset.shouldMirrorLeftHandedModel
member.summary: Left-handed character skeleton is mirrored, so most item models are mirrored again to preserve appearance. Unfortunately this does not work well for some items e.g. the particle system on Elver/Dango glasses.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.ItemClothingAsset.wearAudio
member.summary: Sound to play when equipped.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.ItemClothingAsset.skinOverride
member.summary: If set, find a child meshrenderer with this name and change its material to the character skin material.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.ItemClothingAsset.TakesPriorityOverCosmetic
member.summary: The player can be wearing both a "real" in-game item and a cosmetic item in the same clothing slot. If true, the real item is shown rather than the cosmetic item. For example, night vision goggles are shown over any glasses cosmetic because of their gameplay-related green glow.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.ItemClothingAsset.priorityOverCosmeticOverride
member.summary: Overrides value of TakesPriorityOverCosmetic if is true.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.ItemClothingAsset.hasPriorityOverCosmeticOverride
member.summary: If true, the value of is used rather than . Defaults to false. True if is set.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.ItemClothingAsset.ClothingPrefab
member.summary: For 3D clothes. Ideally, this wouldn't be type specific, but we have a separate prefab property for each type of clothing at the moment.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.ItemClothingAsset.GetDefaultTakesPriorityOverCosmetic
member.summary: The player can be wearing both a "real" in-game item and a cosmetic item in the same clothing slot. This is called on the real item if has not been set. If true, the real item is shown rather than the cosmetic item. If false, the cosmetic item can be seen.

Only applicable for operations with a target item.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.Blueprint.CanBeVisibleWithUnmetConditions
member.summary: Defaults to false. If true, blueprint can become visible in the crafting list even when NPC conditions are not met. This should typically only be enabled if all conditions are configured to be visible in the details panel. Otherwise, the default "conditions unmet" label isn't very informative for players.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.DialogueMessage.FindPrevDialogueAsset
member.summary:
The dialogue to go to when a message has no available responses. If this is not specified the previous dialogue is used as a default. If neither is available then a default "goodbye" response is added.
For example, Chief_Police_Doughnuts_Accepted dialogue has a single message "Let's just keep this between the two of us." shown with "prev" dialogue set to the NPC's root dialogue asset.

member.name: T:SDG.Unturned.EBlueprintType
member.summary:
Nelson 2025-04-09: this acted as both category AND behaviour modifier, so I'm separating it into a custom tag for categorization and a property for overriding how the blueprint processes input items.
Nelson 2025-04-10: repair and ammo "types" had a variety of quirks I wanted to sort out: • Moving amount between items required ammo type blueprint, but some modders expressed interest in non-ammo use. (I.e., ideally better supporting amount on non-ammo items going forward.) • Both types ignored output items. Output was used to represent the target item. Similarly, the UI added a fake extra input item representing target item. • PlayerCrafting and PlayerDashboardCraftingUI re-implemented some crafting item searching logic for finding the item to refill or repair that can be converted into input item parameters. The plan at the moment is to make the last input item the "target" item for operations. Legacy ammo/repair blueprints will then default to no output item and add an extra input item. (And add a variety of parameters needed to replicate the specialized item search behaviour.)

member.summary: No special modification to input items.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.EBlueprintOperation.FillTargetItem
member.summary: Transfer amount from input items to target item.

member.name: T:SDG.Unturned.HousingEdge
member.summary: Initially these were structs so that they would be adjacent in memory and therefore faster to iterate lots of them, but making them classes lets them reference each other which significantly simplifies finding adjactent housing parts.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.HousingEdge.forwardFloors
member.summary: Item along positive direction. Can be multiple on existing saves or if players found an exploit.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.HousingEdge.backwardFloors
member.summary: Item along negative direction. Can be multiple on existing saves or if players found an exploit.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.HousingEdge.walls
member.summary: Item between floors. Can be multiple on existing saves or if players found an exploit.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.HousingEdge.HasFullHeightWall
member.summary: Is there a wall in this slot, and is it full height (not rampart)?

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.HousingEdge.CanAttachRoof
member.summary:
This check prevents placing roof onto the upper edge of a rampart because ramparts create an edge at full wall height even though they are short.
Ideally in the future wall height will become configurable and remove the need for this check.
See public issue #3590.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.HousingVertex.position
member.summary: Position at the base of the pillar.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.HousingVertex.rotation
member.summary: Yaw if placing pillar at this vertex.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.HousingVertex.pillars
member.summary: Pillar or post currently occupying this slot. Can be multiple on existing saves or if players found an exploit.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.HousingVertex.floors
member.summary: Can be zero if pillar is floating, or up to six in the center of a triangular circle.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.HousingVertex.HasFullHeightPillar
member.summary: Is there a pillar in this slot, and is it full height (not post)?

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.EHousingPlacementResult.MissingGround
member.summary: Floors must be placed touching the terrain, or a fake-terrain object like a grassy cliff model.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.EHousingPlacementResult.ObstructedByGround
member.summary: Pillars can be partly underground or inside a designated allowed underground area. Otherwise, if the very top of the pillar is underground placement is blocked. (public issue #4250)

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.HousingConnections.EDGE_LENGTH
member.summary: Side length of square and triangular floor/roof. Walls can be slightly less, but we treat them as if they are the full length.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.HousingConnections.WALL_PIVOT_OFFSET
member.summary: Vertical distance from edge center to wall pivot.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.HousingConnections.RAMPART_PIVOT_OFFSET
member.summary: Vertical distance from edge center to rampart pivot.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.HousingConnections.LINK_TOLERANCE
member.summary: If position is nearly equal within this threshold then edges/vertices will connect.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.HousingConnections.MAX_PLACEMENT_DISTANCE
member.summary: Maximum distance from player's viewpoint to allow placement.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.HousingConnections.MAX_FIND_EMPTY_SLOT_DISTANCE
member.summary: How far to search for empty slot best match.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.HousingConnections.MIN_FIND_EMPTY_SLOT_COSINE
member.summary: Cosine of the angle between ray direction and direction toward slot must be greater than this.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.HousingConnections.PLACEMENT_OVERLAP_PADDING
member.summary: When validating item placement expand physics overlap this much. Useful to ensure slightly-touching overlaps (e.g. pillar touching the pillar above) are handled properly.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.HousingConnections.CHARACTER_OVERLAP_PADDING
member.summary: Ensure players, vehicles, zombies, animals, etc are not within this distance of pending placement.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.HousingConnections.TRIANGLE_APEX_PIVOT_OFFSET
member.summary: Distance from triangle pivot to apex of triangle.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.HousingConnections.TRIANGLE_INNER_RADIUS
member.summary: Radius of circle within triangle edges.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.HousingConnections.TRIANGLE_CENTER_PIVOT_OFFSET
member.summary: Distance from triangle pivot to center of triangle.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.HousingConnections.FOUNDATION_TOP_MARGIN
member.summary: Small threshold to allow placing even with existing barricades on the floor.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.HousingConnections.HOUSE_OVERLAP_LAYER_MASK
member.summary: House overlap is approximately the same size as the housing item's collider(s), and is intended to check whether any pre-existing barricades or structural items are in the way. For example whether a wall cannot be placed because there is a storage crate in the way, or if a foundation is blocked by another slightly rotated foundation.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.HousingConnections.CHARACTER_OVERLAP_LAYER_MASK
member.summary: Character overlap is slightly larger than the house overlap, and checks whether any players, vehicles, animals, zombies, etc are nearby. This is necessary because when house and characters were combined in a single physics query it was possible to stand *just* close enough to step into the collider as it was spawned.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.PlayerManager.IsClientUnderFakeLagPenalty
member.summary: Whether local client is currently penalized for potentially using a lag switch. Server has an equivalent check which reduces damage dealt, whereas the clientside check stops shooting in order to prevent abuse of inbound-only lagswitches. For example, if a cheater freezes enemy positions by dropping inbound traffic while still sending movement and shooting outbound traffic.

member.name: T:SDG.Unturned.UnturnedLog
member.summary: Unturned wrapper for Debug.Log, Debug.LogWarning, Debug.LogError, etc.

member.summary: Log an exception with message providing context.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.UnturnedLog.internalException(System.Exception)
member.summary:
Recursively logs inner exception.
Should only be called by itself and exception because notifications to CommandWindow would otherwise get re-sent here as errors.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.UnturnedLog.onBuiltinUnityLogMessageReceived(System.String,System.String,UnityEngine.LogType)
member.summary:
This is the ONLY place Unturned should be binding logMessageReceived.
This gives us greater control over how logging is handled. In particular, Unity's headless builds route logs (including stack traces) through stdout which is undesirable for dedicated servers, so we only call Debug.Log* in the editor and development builds.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.PlayerNPCQuestUI.pendingResponse
member.summary:
Valid when opened in Begin or End mode.
If the quest is ready to complete the UI is opened in End mode to allow the player to see what rewards they will receive after clicking continue. Otherwise, in Begin mode the UI is opened to allow the player to review the conditions before accepting or declining the request.
If the player cancels the pending response is NOT chosen.

member.summary: Valid when opened in Begin or End mode. The player clicked pendingResponse in this dialogue to open the quest UI.

member.name: T:SDG.Unturned.LevelNetIdRegistry
member.summary: It is useful to be able to reference transforms generically over the network, for example to attach a bullet hole to a tree or vehicle without tagging it as a tree or vehicle, but most entities placed in the level do not have unique IDs. To work around this we count downward from uint.MaxValue for level objects to avoid conflicts with server-assigned net ids.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.LevelNetIdRegistry.GetTreeNetId(System.Byte,System.Byte,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Each region can have ushort.MaxValue trees, and we reserve that entire block so that a region can be slightly modified on the client or server without breaking all netids in the level.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.LevelNetIdRegistry.GetRegularObjectNetId(System.Byte,System.Byte,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Each region can have ushort.MaxValue objects, and we reserve that entire block so that a region can be slightly modified on the client or server without breaking all netids in the level.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.LevelNetIdRegistry.GetDevkitObjectNetId(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Devkit instance IDs should already be fairly stable. There is no way any level is using more than 30 bits for the instance ID, so it should be safe to set those bits to prevent collisions with server net IDs.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.SteamServerAdvertisement.NormalizedPlayerCount
member.summary: Active player count divided by max player count.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.SteamServerAdvertisement.PingUtilityScore
member.summary: Nelson 2024-08-20: This score is intended to prioritize low ping without making it the be-all end-all. The old default of sorting by ping could put near-empty servers at the top of the list, and encouraged using anycast caching to make the server appear as low-ping as possible.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.SteamServerAdvertisement.FullnessUtilityScore
member.summary: Nelson 2024-08-20: This score is intended to prioritize servers around 75% capacity. My thought process is that near-empty and near-full servers are already easy to find, but typically if you want to play online you want a server with space for you and your friends. Unfortunately, servers with plenty of players but an even higher max players make a 50% score plenty good.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.SteamServerAdvertisement.PlayerCountUtilityScore
member.summary: Nelson 2024-08-20: This score is intended to balance out the downside of the fullness score decreasing for servers with very high max player counts, and over-scoring servers with low max players.

member.name: T:SDG.Unturned.TireMotionEffectInstance
member.summary: When moving between physics materials we need to continue any previous tire kickup particles until they expire. This class manages the individual effect per-physics-material. Each wheel can have multiple at once. When the particles have despawned and the effect is no longer needed, the effect game object is returned to the effect pool and this class is returned to .

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.Wheel.CalculateNormalizedSuspensionPosition(UnityEngine.Vector3)
member.summary:
Calculate suspension state from GetWorldPose result.
Nelson 2024-03-25: Originally we used the result of GetWorldPose for the model transform and calculated the suspension state from it because I thought Unity was internally using the spring position that isn't (currently) exposed to the API. Whether or not it is, it seems fine to calculate the spring position using the ground hit point instead. We switched entirely away from GetWorldPose so that the wheel can retain its roll angle when transitioning between locally simulated and replicated.

member.name: T:SDG.Unturned.EAttackInputFlags
member.summary:
Start/Stop input is encoded as 2 bits, 1 bit for Start flag and 1 bit for Stop flag.
Prior to 2023-03-16 it was a single bit. The server would Start if true and the previous frame was false, and vice versa call Stop if false and the previous frame was true. The problem with that approach was when the client FPS is higher than the simulation FPS a series of repeated attack presses would be treated as a continuous held attack input. Semi-auto guns were difficult to shoot at their max rate of fire. Sending both allows the server to theoretically call Start every simulation frame as opposed to only half.
First approach was to OR Start if held, otherwise OR Stop. This doesn't work because for example when Aim is pressed the Stop flag will already be enabled, so the gun Starts aiming, Stops aiming, Starts aiming, and then stays aiming rather than just Start and stay aiming. Instead we only want Stop to be sent once.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.EAttackInputFlags.Start
member.summary: Wants to "start" primary or secondary input. (e.g., Useable.startPrimary)

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.EAttackInputFlags.Stop
member.summary: Wants to "stop" primary or secondary input. (e.g., Useable.stopPrimary)

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.PhysicsTool.GetLegacyMaterialByName(System.String)
member.summary: Get legacy enum corresponding to Unity physics material object name. Moved from obsolete checkMaterial method.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.PhysicsTool.GetColliderSharedPhysicsMaterialName(UnityEngine.Collider)
member.summary:
If collider and its physics material are not null, get the physics material's name. Null otherwise.
Nelson 2025-04-22: this method may seem silly on first glance. However, I tracked down some every-frame memory allocation to getting the PhysicMaterial.name property. This method caches the instance ID to name lookup in a dictionary to avoid that. Note: we don't worry about clearing the dictionary because there aren't very many physics materials.

member.name: T:SDG.Unturned.ServerConnectParameters
member.summary:
Parameters for connecting to a game server.
Admittedly there are other parameters to the Connect method, but those are for detecting advertisement discrepencies and can be null.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.ServerConnectParameters.address
member.summary: Server's public IP address of a Steam "Fake IP" address.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.ServerConnectParameters.queryPort
member.summary: Port for Steam's "A2S" query system. This the port we refer to when sharing a server's address (e.g., 127.0.0.1:queryport).

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.ServerConnectParameters.connectionPort
member.summary: Port for game traffic. i.e., Steam manages the query port socket while we manage the connection port socket. The game assumes it's the query port plus one. NOTE HOWEVER after the introduction of "Fake IP" support (2023-12-07) the connection port is the same as the query port for fake IPs. In keeping with the spirit of fake values to simplify existing code, we act as if the connection port is plus one except in the appropriate ClientTransport code when the fake IP is detected.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.ServerConnectParameters.steamId
member.summary: Referred to as "Server Code" in menus. Used if address is zero.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.RegionVisibilityData.progressIndex
member.summary:
If -1, this region is finished activating/deactivating. Otherwise, incremented once per frame until per-region count is reached.
Per-region data is removed when isInsideMask is false and progressIndex is -1.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.RegionVisibilityData.isInsideMask
member.summary: If true, this region is within MaxDistance of current CameraCoord.

member.name: T:SDG.Unturned.RegionIncrementalVisibilityTracker

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.RegionIncrementalVisibilityTracker.FlushProgress

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.RegionIncrementalVisibilityTracker.UpdateRegions(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{UnityEngine.Vector2Int,SDG.Unturned.RegionVisibilityData})
member.summary: Caller passes an empty dictionary to be filled with update info. Increments progressIndex for each returned region. If region is finished updating, call NotifyRegionFinishedUpdating.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.RegionIncrementalVisibilityTracker.NotifyRegionFinishedUpdating(UnityEngine.Vector2Int)
member.summary: Called when progressIndex has reached end of given region.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.RegionIncrementalVisibilityTracker.PopulateCoordsInsideMask(System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{UnityEngine.Vector2Int})
member.summary: Fill output set with mask offsets applied to current camera coordinate.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.RegionIncrementalVisibilityTracker.ApplyCoordChanges
member.summary: Find changes between old and current coordinate sets to mark regions in/out of mask.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.RegionIncrementalVisibilityTracker.SetCoordIsInsideMask(UnityEngine.Vector2Int,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reset region's progress counter and change inside/outside status.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.BulletInfo.origin

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.BulletInfo.ApproximatePlayerAimDirection
member.summary: Only available on the server. For use by plugins developers who want to analyze deviation between approximate start direction and final hit position using and per public issue #4450. Note that origin and direction on server are not necessarily exactly the same as on the client for a variety of reasons, including that bullets on the client can be spawned between simulation frames when the aim direction was different. (Aim direction is updated every drawn frame on the client as opposed to every simulation frame on the server.) Rather than kicking for one particularly large deviation we would recommend tracking stats for each shot's actual deviation vs max theoretical deviation. Remember to account for bullet drop and that aim spread is relative to this direction. (For example, a shotgun may fire ~8 pellets in a cone around this direction.) Note also that in third-person the bullet can turn up to 90 degrees from the aim direction if the camera is up against a wall.

member.name: T:SDG.Unturned.PlayerInventorySearchParameters
member.summary:
Consolidates parameters for older, separate inventory search methods.
The "player" part of the name refers to the PlayerInventory-specific parameters. It can still be used to search the Items class, in which case those parameters do not apply.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.PlayerInventorySearchParameters.Results
member.summary: List to populate with matching items.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.PlayerInventorySearchParameters.IncludeEquipmentSlots
member.summary: If true, search player's primary and secondary weapon slots. Only applicable when used with PlayerInventory class. (I.e., not Items class.)

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.PlayerInventorySearchParameters.IncludeActiveStorageContainer
member.summary: If true, search storage container player is currently interacting with (if any). Only applicable when used with PlayerInventory class. (I.e., not Items class.)

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.PlayerInventorySearchParameters.MaxResultsCount
member.summary: If greater than zero, search exits early once Results count meets MaxResultCount.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.PlayerInventorySearchParameters.ItemType
member.summary: If set, item must be this type to match.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.PlayerInventorySearchParameters.AssetRef
member.summary: If set, AssetRef must be a reference to item's asset to match. Replaces older "id" parameter which matched if item's legacy asset ID was the same.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.PlayerInventorySearchParameters.IncludeEmpty
member.summary: If true, items with amount of zero can match. Otherwise, they are ignored. Replaces older "findEmpty" parameter which matched if (findEmpty || amount > 0).

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.PlayerInventorySearchParameters.ExcludeFullAmount
member.summary: If true, items with an "amount" >= their MaxAmount are ignored. Otherwise, they can match (default).

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.PlayerInventorySearchParameters.CaliberId
member.summary: If set, item must be of type ItemCaliberAsset. Asset's caliber list must either: • Contain this caliber ID. • Or, if empty, IncludeUnspecifiedCaliber must be true. Otherwise, item is ignored.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.PlayerInventorySearchParameters.AnyCaliberIds
member.summary: If set, item must be of type ItemCaliberAsset. Asset's caliber list must either: • Contain one of these caliber IDs. • Or, if empty, IncludeUnspecifiedCaliber must be true. Otherwise, item is ignored.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.PlayerInventorySearchParameters.IncludeUnspecifiedCaliber
member.summary: Only applicable if CaliberId or AnyCaliberIds is set. If true, assets with an empty calibers list can match. Otherwise, they are ignore.d

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.PlayerInventorySearchParameters.ItemToIgnore
member.summary: If set, do not include this specific item instance in search results. Kind of hacked-in for ignoring "target item" as a potential input item.

member.name: T:SDG.Unturned.PlayerInventorySearchResultV2
member.summary: Nearly identical to InventorySearch aside from: • Struct instead of class to improve garbage collection performance in pooled lists. • More understandable name. • Provides reference to Items holding "Jar." Longer-term this should be preferred over the "Page" property.

member.summary: Serverside delete an amount of this item.
member.returns: Total amount deleted.

member.summary: -1 if no eligible item is found. If includeMaxQuality is true an item with quality of 100 can be "lowest quality", otherwise item has to be less than 100 quality.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.InteractableObjectBinaryStateEventHook.InvokeWhenInitialized
member.summary: Should the OnStateEnabled and OnStateDisabled events be invoked when the object is loaded, becomes relevant in multiplayer, and is reset? True is useful when visuals need to be kept in sync with the state, whereas false is useful for transient interactions.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.InteractableObjectBinaryStateEventHook.ListenServerHostMode
member.summary: Controls how state change requests are performed when running as both client and server ("listen server"). On the dedicated server, requesting a state change overrides the current state without processing NPC conditions, whereas when a client requests a state change NPC conditions apply. This option fixes the inconsistency in singleplayer of whether to treat as server or client. (public issue #4298) At the time of writing (2024-01-29) listen server only applies to singleplayer.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.InteractableObjectBinaryStateEventHook.GotoEnabledState
member.summary:
Set state to Enabled if currently Disabled.
On dedicated server this directly changes the state, but as client this will apply the usual conditions and rewards.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.InteractableObjectBinaryStateEventHook.GotoDisabledState
member.summary:
Set state to Disabled if currently Enabled.
On dedicated server this directly changes the state, but as client this will apply the usual conditions and rewards.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.InteractableObjectBinaryStateEventHook.ToggleState
member.summary:
Toggle between the Enabled and Disabled states.
On dedicated server this directly changes the state, but as client this will apply the usual conditions and rewards.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.Types.QUATERNION_TYPE
member.summary: Not originally supported by networking. Added temporarily during netpak rewrite because the quaternion compression is so much better for vehicles than three byte Euler rotation.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.PowerTool.checkFires(UnityEngine.Vector3,System.Single)
member.summary: Nelson 2025-04-08: thank goodness that this didn't use the temperature system! (For some reason?) Makes it relatively straightforward to convert campfires and ovens to Crafting Tags, and means vanilla has a test case for the mod hook, too. (This method tests for CraftingHeatTag in radius.)

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.ClientAssetIntegrity.Clear
member.summary: Reset prior to joining a new server.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.ClientAssetIntegrity.ServerAddKnownMissingAsset(System.Guid,System.String)
member.summary: By default if the client submits an asset guid which the server cannot find an asset for the client will be kicked. This is necessary to prevent cheaters from spamming huge numbers of random guids. In certain cases like a terrain material missing the server knows the client will be missing it as well, and can register it here to prevent the client from being kicked unnecessarily.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.ClientAssetIntegrity.QueueRequest(System.Guid,SDG.Unturned.Asset,System.String)
member.summary:
Send asset hash (or lack thereof) to server.
IMPORTANT: should only be called in cases where the server has verified the asset exists by loading it, otherwise only if the asset exists on the client. This is because the server kicks if the asset does not exist in order to prevent hacked clients from spamming requests. Context parameter is intended to help narrow down cases where this rule is being broken.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.ClientAssetIntegrity.QueueRequest(SDG.Unturned.Asset)
member.summary: Send asset hash to server. Used in cases where server does not verify asset exists. (see other method's comment)

member.name: T:SDG.Unturned.ENetInvocationDeferMode
member.summary: Defines how instance methods handle invocation when the target instance does not exist yet, for example if the target instance is async loading or has time sliced instantiation.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.ENetInvocationDeferMode.Discard
member.summary: Invocation should be ignored if the target instance does not exist. This is the only applicable defer mode for static methods and server methods.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.ENetInvocationDeferMode.Queue
member.summary: Invocation will be queued up if the target instance does not exist. Originally an "Overwrite" mode was considered for cases like SetHealth where only the newest value is displayed, but this was potentially error-prone if multiple queued methods depended on values from each other.

member.name: T:SDG.Unturned.SleekFullscreenBox
member.summary: Almost every menu has a container element for its contents which spans the entire screen. This element is then animated into and out of view. In the IMGUI implementation this was fine because containers off-screen were not processed, but with uGUI they were still considered active. To solve the uGUI performance overhead this class was introduced to disable visibility after animating out of view.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.PlayerWorkzone.UpdateHandlesPreferredPivot
member.summary: Set handles pivot point according to selection transform. Doesn't apply if handle is currently being dragged.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.AssetBundleCustomData.ownerWorkshopFileId
member.summary: If Unturned is loading this asset bundle from a Steam workshop file but the file ID does not match then loading will be canceled. Prevents the asset bundle from being easily copied/stolen.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.AssetBundleCustomData.ownerWorkshopFileIds
member.summary:
Same as ownerWorkshopFileId for cases where the asset bundle is allowed in multiple uploads.
Uploading the same asset bundle multiple times is not ideal because the game doesn't handle multiple of them with the same name well, and Unity logs an error if an asset bundle with the same files is already loaded. That being said, the game doesn't handle dependencies between workshop files well either (as of 2023-01-12), so this is perhaps the lesser of two evils.
My understanding is that some mod creators license their work to multiple servers that upload the files and this property will make it easier so it doesn't need to be re-exported multiple times.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.InteractableStorage.shouldCloseWhenOutsideRange
member.summary: If player gets too far away from this storage while using it, should we close out? False by default for trunk storage because player is inside vehicle. Plugins needed to be able to set this to false for "virtual storage" plugins, so we default to false and set to true if asset enables it.

member.name: T:SDG.Unturned.ERaycastInfoUsage
member.summary: Tags how client expects server to use a raycast input. For example, client may think they fired a gun while server thinks they dequipped the gun, so tagging the input prevents the server from handling it as a punch instead.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.WalkingPlayerInputPacket.clientPosition

member.summary: Called for every input packet received allowing plugins to listen for a few special keys they can display in chat/effect UIs.

member.name: P:SDG.Unturned.PlayerInput.IsUnderFakeLagPenalty
member.summary: Whether client is currently penalized for potentially using a lag switch. False positives are relatively likely when client framerate hitches (e.g. loading dense region), so we only modify their stats (e.g. reduce player damage) for a corresponding duration.

member.name: M:SDG.Unturned.PlayerInput.getInput(System.Boolean,SDG.Unturned.ERaycastInfoUsage)
member.summary: Get the hit result of a raycast on the server. Until a generic way to address net objects is implemented this is how legacy features specify which player/animal/zombie/vehicle/etc they want to interact with.

member.summary: Ideally simulation frame number would be signed, but there is a lot of code expecting unsigned.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.PlayerInput.debugDiscardInputs
member.summary: Can be enabled in the unity inspector to test that discarding inputs recovers properly.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.PlayerInput.EXPECTED_ASKINPUT_PER_SECOND
member.summary: askInput is always called the same number of times per second because it's run from FixedUpdate, but the spacing between calls can vary depending on network and whether client FPS is low.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.PlayerInput.MAX_ASKINPUT_PER_SECOND
member.summary: If average askInput calls per second exceeds this, we either ignore their request or flat-out kick them.

member.name: F:SDG.Unturned.PlayerInput.KICK_ASKINPUT_PER_SECOND
member.summary: If average askInput calls per second exceeds this we silently kick them.

member.name: T:SDG.Framework.Foliage.FoliageStorageV2
member.summary:
Replacement foliage storage with all tiles in a single file.
In the level editor all tiles are loaded into memory, whereas during gameplay the relevant tiles are loaded as-needed by a worker thread.

member.name: M:SDG.Framework.Foliage.FoliageStorageV2.WorkerThreadMain
member.summary: Entry point for worker thread loop.

member.name: F:SDG.Framework.Foliage.FoliageStorageV2.mainThreadTilesWithRelevancyChanges
member.summary: Order is important because TileBecameRelevant is called from the closest tile outward.

member.name: F:SDG.Framework.Foliage.FoliageStorageV2.tileBlobOffsets
member.summary: Offsets into blob for per-tile data.

member.name: F:SDG.Framework.Foliage.FoliageStorageV2.assetsHeader
member.summary: Tiles save an index into this list rather than guid.

member.name: F:SDG.Framework.Foliage.FoliageStorageV2.tileBlobHeaderOffset
member.summary: Offset from header data.

member.name: T:SDG.Framework.Foliage.FoliageStorageV2.TilePerAssetData
member.summary: Data-only FoliageInstanceList shared between threads.

member.name: T:SDG.Framework.Foliage.FoliageStorageV2.TileData
member.summary: Data-only FoliageTile shared between threads.

member.name: F:SDG.Framework.Foliage.FoliageStorageV2.mainThreadTileDataFromPreviousUpdate
member.summary: Ready to be released to the worker thread during the next lock.

member.name: F:SDG.Framework.Foliage.FoliageStorageV2.lockObject
member.summary: Mutex lock. Only used in the main thread Update loop and worker thread loop.

member.name: F:SDG.Framework.Foliage.FoliageStorageV2.workerThreadTileQueue
member.summary: SHARED BY BOTH THREADS! Coordinates requested by main thread for worker thread to read. This is a list because while main thread is busy the worker thread can continue reading.

member.name: F:SDG.Framework.Foliage.FoliageStorageV2.tileDataFromWorkerThread
member.summary: SHARED BY BOTH THREADS! Tiles read by worker thread ready to be copied into actual foliage tiles on main thread.

member.name: F:SDG.Framework.Foliage.FoliageStorageV2.tileDataFromMainThread
member.summary: SHARED BY BOTH THREADS! Main thread has finished using this tile data and it can be released back to the pool on the worker thread. This is a list because main thread could have populated multiple foliage tiles while the worker thread was busy reading.

member.name: F:SDG.Framework.Foliage.FoliageStorageV2.perAssetDataPool
member.summary: Lifecycle: 1. Worker thread claims or allocates data. 2. Worker thread passes data to main thread. 3. Main thread copies data over to actual foliage tile. 4. Main thread passes data back to worker thread. 5. Worker thread releases data back to pool.

member.name: F:SDG.Framework.Foliage.FoliageSystem.batches
member.summary: Nelson 2025-04-22: instanced foliage rendering is a decent chunk of CPU time. In retrospect this seems like an obvious optimization: Graphics.DrawMeshInstanced accepts up to 1023 instances per call. Each tile groups instances in lists of up to 1023, but often isn't that high. Now, we collect instances until we hit the 1023 limit. This is particularly useful for sparse variants like colored flowers. With a consistent camera transform ("/copycameratransform") on an upcoming map remaster I went from between 0.72-0.8 ms on my PC to 0.55-0.6 ms!

member.name: F:SDG.Framework.Foliage.FoliageSystem.DRAW_OFFSETS
member.summary: 2022-04-26: drawTiles previously looped over a square [-N, +N] from the upper-left to the bottom-right, and each tile checked radial distance. We can improve over this by pre-computing the radial offsets and starting from the center to improve responsiveness. N is [1, 5]

member.name: F:SDG.Framework.Foliage.FoliageSystem.foliageRenderLayer
member.summary: 2022-04-26: this used to be environment layer, but "scope focus foliage" can draw outside that render distance so we now use the sky layer which is visible up to the far clip plane.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.CharacterControllerExtension.CheckedMove(UnityEngine.CharacterController,UnityEngine.Vector3)
member.summary:
Perform a move, then do a capsule cast to determine if Unity PhysX went through a wall.
Required when disabling overlap recovery because there are issues when walking toward slopes that bend inward. To test if Unity works properly in the future; walk toward the inside of a barracks building in the PEI base.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.CharacterControllerExtension.EnableDetectCollisionsNextFrame(UnityEngine.CharacterController)
member.summary: Set detectCollisions to true on the next frame. Useful when CharacterController is teleported to prevent adding huge forces to overlapping rigidbodies.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.CharacterControllerExtension.SetDetectCollisionsDeferred(UnityEngine.CharacterController,System.Boolean)
member.summary: If true EnableDetectCollisionsNextFrame, if false DisableDetectCollisions.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.CharacterControllerExtension.OnUpdate
member.summary: Intentionally Update, not FixedUpdate. Physics transforms are applied between frames, whereas at low frame rates there may be multiple FixedUpdates per frame.
